text:
39 y/o M with ETOH abuse who presented on [**3-18**] with lactic acidosis and
   profound weakness. He was found to be severely thiamine deficient
   consistent with a diagnosis of Beri Beri.  Pt was repleted aggressively
   with Thiamine, MIV and had an NG placed for nutrition.  He developed
   re-feeding syndrome requiring aggressive electrolyte repletion.  He
   developed ETOH withdrawal and mental status changes approximately
   24-48hr after admission.  He was treated with small doses of Valium and
   mental status improved somewhat before he was called out to medicine on
   [**3-21**].
    On [**3-23**], he was advanced a dysphagia diet and the following day, he
   spiked a fever to 101.8.  Initial infectious work up revealed negative
   UA, neg Blood Cx, negative Cdiff and possible infiltrate on CXR. Chest
   CT revealed bilateral pleural effusions and atelectasis.
   He triggered on [**2191-3-24**] for tachypnea, tachycardia, and hypoxia.  His
   hypoxia resolved, and CTA was subsequently negative for PE.  Mental
   status further deteriorated after fevers began and there was concern
   for intermittent seizures due to bilateral upper extremity tremors and
   periodic eye deviation.  2mg Ativan given without significant
   improvement.  Pt was loaded with Keppra 1gram, started on Acyclovir
   700mg IV TID and Keppra 1500mg [**Hospital1 7**].  Neuro attending recommended
   transfer to MICU for continuous EEG monitoring.
   Upon arrival to MICU, he was transported pt to head ct which was + for
   small 4 mm subdural. Throughout the night, ? r/t keppra dosing pt
   became more somnulent, acidotic and o2 dependent. He was intubated then
   ([**3-26**]) for airway protection.
   .H/O airway, Inability to Protect (Risk for Aspiration, Altered Gag,
   Airway Clearance, Cough)
   Assessment:
   Suctioning ETT for scant white sputum. Lung sounds rhonchorus. More
   awake. +Gag and cough
   Action:
   Pulm toilet. Oral care. S
s q2-3 hrs. No sedation given.
   Response:
   More awake, following commands. Probably able to protect his own airway
   now.
   Plan:
   Monitor mental status, ?extubation today.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   No seizure activity noted. More awake, following commands. Appears to
   be alert
   Action:
   Continuous EEG monitoring,  Keppra per feeding tube.  Lactulose.
   Attempted mri of head.. unable to do d/t hardware attached to leads per
   mri tech
   Response:
   mental status improved. Lg amts stool output No seizure activity noted.
   Plan:
   Monitor mental/neuro status. Continuous EEG. ?attempt MRI once off cont
   eeg.
